title: Senior Implementation Consultant
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Microsoft D365 ERP Senior Technical Implementation Consultant with 3+ years of experience in implementing Microsoft D365 and/or financial add-ons for Microsoft D365.  The Microsoft D365 Implementation Consultant will work closely with ONESOURCE Project Managers and Tax SME to implement ONESOURCE Determination and Compliance tax software at client sites in Global Implementations.

You will provide customers with domain expertise when implementing tax scenarios, and connecting ONESOURCE Indirect Tax to Microsoft D365 applications including ERP, ecommerce and POS.  As an Implementation Consultant you work with a project team to gather and defined business requirements and convert them into robust and flexible solutions. This position is unique as you will be exposed to customers from all different industries and their business requirements and operations.

**About the Role**

As a **Senior Implementation Consultant**, you will:

* Serve as a primary interface with client tax professionals
* Set-up, organize and lead business and user requirements sessions and formulate into design/solution documentation
* Assist in the analysis and delivery of Microsoft D365 implementations that reflect an in-depth understanding of the client’s tax requirements and compliance process
* Engage with other Thomson Reuters teams as appropriate to deliver end to end Indirect Tax solutions
* Ensure all Indirect tax related requirements are met
* Explain ONESOURCE Integration for Microsoft D365 related issues/problems and solutions to non-tax & technical staff
* Work with clients to translate their tax policy into ONESOURCE Solutions
* Configure ONESOURCE Indirect Tax Integration for Microsoft D365
* Execute personal working within a controlled project management environment
* Work with Pre-sales on prospects and bid development
* Work with functional & technical colleagues to deliver the implementation

About You:
----------

You're a fit for the **Senior Implementation Consultant** role if you have:

* Bachelors degree in Finance, Accounting or Computer Science, or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of work experience with at least 3 of those years working with Microsoft D365.Must have excellent interpersonal and written communication skills
* Proficient technical experience implementing Microsoft D365 and/or Add-on Solutions
* Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues caused when multiple add-ons are installed; must be skilled in troubleshooting and resolving Microsoft D365 system issues
* Experience with process analysis, design, mapping, and re-engineering, as well as process/software gap analysis and resolution
* Experience creating and executing test cases and test scripts
* Working knowledge of the Microsoft D365 application
* Knowledge of APIs, Webservices (SOAP & REST), xml
* Experience configuring transaction taxes and related master data within Microsoft D365
* Experience with integrating third party enterprise tax products (e.g. ONESOURCE Determination, ONESOURCE Compliance, Avalara, Sovos, CCH, Sabrix, Taxware and/or Vertex) is highly desirable
* Ability to write/modify existing integration software and integrate software applications and modules in accordance with agreed upon specifications, created in partnership with others
* Object Oriented Programming experience is desired
* Microsoft D365 Certification is a plus

**What's in it for you?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing**: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-AY1

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. 

**Accessibility** 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

***Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings [click here](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/content/dam/ewp-m/documents/careers/en/pdf/onboarding/fake_job_posting_scam_careers_site.pdf) to know more.***

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on [thomsonreuters.com](https://thomsonreuters.com).

title: Consultant
description:
Job Description   
   
Consultants partner with our customers and drive change in their business through leading software implementations and recommending ideal workflow within an accounting firm for the products of GoFileRoom and FirmFlow.   
   
**About the Role**  
   
In this opportunity as a Consultant, you will: 

* Meet with customers to determine business and technical needs.
* Recommend optimal system configuration and business processes based on industry best practices.
* Prepare and present implementation plans for customer approval.
* Manage and execute implementation plans including directing staff resources (both internal and external), evaluating results, creating documentation of newly created processes and managing overall engagement.
* Train client personnel on use of software solutions and business practices.
* Build and maintain client relationships supporting their use and application of Thomson Reuters Tax & Accounting products.
* Keep product and industry knowledge up to date.
* Manage logistics and administrative tasks for all engagements.

**About You**  
   
You’re a fit for the role of Consultant if your background includes: 

* Bachelor's Degree and/or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of experience in public accounting or consulting or accounting software
* CPA, preferred
* Strong presentation and facilitation skills
* Project management experience with ability to manage multiple projects at one time
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Self-sufficient and able to work well in team settings
* Experience with agile a plus
* Problem solving and situational analysis
* Time management and organization
* Technical acumen
* Comfortable with 25% travel including overnights required (dependent on company policy and current local health travel restrictions)

**What’s in it For You?**

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

* **Hybrid Work Model:** Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
* **Wellbeing:** Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
* **Learning & Development:** LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
* **Social Impact:** Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
* **Purpose Driven Work:** We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency.  Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

Thomson Reuters complies with local laws that require upfront disclosure of the expected pay range for a position. The location(s) for this role include one or more of the following states (CA, CO, CT, NV, WA) and/or remote. The base compensation range for the role in any of those locations is $71,400 - $132,600. This role may also be eligible for an Annual Bonus based on a combination of enterprise and individual performance. Base pay is positioned within the range based on several factors including an individual’s knowledge, skills and experience with consideration given to internal equity. Base pay is one part of a comprehensive Total Reward program which also includes flexible and supportive benefits and other wellbeing programs.
